item.title: 8. Login Log
item.description: In this section, I’ll explain how I implemented the login log functionality. Since this is a single-user application, logging each login might seem unnecessary at first. However, I decided to build this feature to enhance security and maintain visibility over all login activities. Recording login attempts allows me to track unauthorized access or unexpected behavior in the system. 1. item.title: 18. Securing API keys and secrets with Pydantic settings + .env
item.description: Secrets are easy to leak when the project grows. In this backend, I keep configuration and credentials centralized in a Pydantic Settings class and load them from .env. API keys are encrypted at rest, and JWT secrets never live in code. This post documents the exact pattern used in this repo. 1.
